titleInfo.title: Four Corners, Louisiana, Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: Leonard Martin oral history interview, 1993

name.description: Sugarcane farmer and great-grandson of a slave, Leonard Martin was a resident of Four Corners, Louisiana, an unincorporated community south of Franklin, Saint Mary Parish, Louisiana.

subject.topic: African Americans--Louisiana--Saint Mary Parish--Social life and customs.

mods.abstract: The interview records Martin's account of the sale of his great-grandfather as a slave. Martin describes his education; his father's career as the first black schoolteacher in the area; work in sugarcane farming; a dance-hall operator, Alice LeBaude; forms of transportation, including buggy, jumper, and surrey; the marriage of his white maternal grandmother to a Native American; the hospitality of his white uncles; and his own long marriage.; Martin discusses his work in Texas during slow times on the sugarcane farm, life in residence with his father, the use of drugs in Four Corners, All Saints Day, and his religion.
